[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1609 a and today's date is July
6 2018 and it's out of the episode is
the Fed goes all out and removes more
data to shape the economic collapse
narrative let's get into the economic
collapse financial news now the central
bankers they've done many many different
things to get people away from
cryptocurrency and what they're seeing
is that countries now are looking at the
blockchain looking at crypto currencies
there's many different corporations that
are accepting Bitcoin to purchase their
goods and the central banks they're kind
of stuck right now and this is why the
head of the Bank of International
Settlements biz came out and said the
following crypto currency cannot assume
the functions of money now general
manager Augustine Carson's caution young
people against trying to create money
and he was talking about Bitcoin went on
to say that cryptocurrencies do not
fulfill any of the three purposes of
money they are neither a good means of
payment nor a good unit of account nor
are they suitable as a store of value
they failed dramatically on each of
these counts he says cryptocurrencies
they're in a bubble it's a gigantic
Ponzi scheme well let's look at the Fiat
system I mean if we really want to talk
about it it's created out of thin air
there's really no store of value the
only reason people use their currency is
because they were able to weasel their
way into governments especially the
United States where they started the
Federal Reserve and actually we don't
even know if the whole entire law was
actually ratified and from that it
blossomed into many other central banks
and the Rothschilds have been doing this
for a very long time and what we're
getting out of this is
that they are very worried about people
and if you notice what he said people
young people trying to create their own
currency there we're very worried about
this because they realize if the people
decide they don't want to use their
currency system anymore the the central
bank currency system they know they will
lose and this is why they're continually
trying to demonize the crypto market the
blockchain system but it's not working
people are looking at this and other
countries are looking at this and
they're saying you know something it can
be used for many different things and it
can be used as a currency I mean it's
completely electronic it you can pay
very easily with it there's no problems
now if we look at the US dollar for
instance you know they're talking about
store value the US dollar has lost 98
percent of its value since 1913 so how
is that a store of value and what they
do is they just continually keep you
looking at the crypto currency telling
you why it's so bad and if you actually
just take your eyes off of that for a
second and look at the Fiat or Fayette
system you can see that their system is
absolutely awful and remember when you
issue something and you create a crypto
currency a coin there's no interest
attached compared to the central bank
where when they create their currency by
pushing a button they attach interest
loan it to the government and the people
then are enslaved to pay that back so
that is a very big difference now here
in the United States we see the payroll
numbers the unemployment numbers they've
come out and in June the US labor market
continued to chug along there remember
all these numbers are manipulated
they're not real they go back and revise
and they leave people off of the count
and we've been talking about this for a
very long time and these calculations
have not changed since the crisis
actually they manipulated them even more
to make it look like the economy's doing
a lot better than it really is and we
see that the April payroll changes they
were revised up from 150
thousand two hundred seventy-five and
with these revisions employment gains in
April and May combined worth
thirty-seven thousand more than
previously reported and they had to do
this because these entire systems
breaking down now the unemployment rate
went from three point eight to four
point zero percent which really doesn't
matter but the labor force participation
rate it's bouncing around between sixty
two point seven to sixty two point nine
percent and we are all the way back to
nineteen seventy levels and we see right
now that when people are not looking for
a job they still want a job but they
haven't been on an interview they're
just not counted as looking for a job
and we can see how they could skew all
these numbers now what's very
interesting in the unemployment report
from the BLS it says that part-time
workers well they increased and
full-time workers decline now we know
there's a lot of retail stores that are
closing Toys R Us for instance just laid
off around thirty three thousand people
we know a lot other stores have been
closing a lot of their stores and for
them for us to hear the news that
part-time work has gone up we know that
this is fake phony and false and
remember the people that are losing
their jobs especially in retail if they
aren't working a certain number of hours
and making a certain amount of money per
week when they lose their job it's not
counted as a loss but if someone gets a
job part-time making that you know
amount of money working those hours it's
counted as a full-time job or a part
time job so we see how they manipulate
all these numbers and we talked about
vacancies yesterday we talked about
unemployment we talked about GDP we
talked about retail sales and statistics
it's very easily manipulated and
basically what they do is they just
manipulate all these numbers to fit
their narrative we see out Manhattan the
real estate bubble appears to have just
burst 54% of
sails in the second quarter close below
asking price and the lowball offers
coincide with a significant 17 percent
decline in sales versus 2017 resulting
in the lowest second quarter tally since
now Manhattan home buyers are getting
bolder these days demanding bargains or
they're just walking away from the deals
in the market and what we're seeing is
individuals are lowering their price or
they're taking their homes off the
market because they don't want to lower
the price we saw this back prior to 2008
where people put their houses up for
sale
they started out at a very high price
and they started lowering them a little
bit then lowered it a little bit and
then eventually they said well it's not
even worth it I'm not going to sell it
so they took it off the market and what
happened then people were waiting for
these prices to continually drop drop
drop drop drop and many people never
really even went out to purchase a house
because they were losing jobs on the
other end so we're starting to see the
same thing occur once again and it's
just beginning but we see out in Canada
Australia Europe those bubbles are
bursting right now we see Russian Prime
Minister well he assigned a decree this
morning imposing higher tariffs on US
products in retaliation for US duties on
metal imports and really what's
happening right now is that we have
China we have Russia we have the US with
this trade war going on and it's not the
typical trade war that we might think of
because I think what they're trying to
do here is they're coming together
working together to bring down the
entire central bank system now remember
the central bank system is made up many
different pieces we have the World Trade
Organization which we know that Trump is
going after we have NAFTA TPP has
already been struck down we have the
central banking system that issues the
currency and they're trying to take the
global economy and Russia already
understands that the global economy is
breaking down China already understands
the global economies breaking down and
they're trying to rip this whole thing
apart and we see right now that Russia
well how much longer are they going to
stay in
World Trade Organization how much longer
is trying to gonna stay in the World
Trade Organization and how much longer
is the u.s. going to stay in the World
Trade Organization I think they're all
working together to bring the system
down and like I said each side is going
to try to control a narrative we have
the central bank's on one side and those
that who are opposed to the central bank
um we know that Russia has taken over
their private western central bank
system and they call the shots not the
Rothschilds we see right now that the
yield curve is flattening and the Fed
revealed that instead of thinking about
backing off rate hikes it's going to
replace the yield curve and I'll explain
what that means in a minute in the
minutes of the F of FOMC meeting on June
12th and 13th which was released
yesterday there was a doozy in there
obscured somewhat by the dynamics of the
rate hike plus the indication that there
would be two more rate hikes this year
for a total of four up from three at the
prior meeting with more hikes to come in
2019 and there were other changes that
were all mixed in with this but the big
doozy in there in the minutes was about
the flattening yield curve now the yield
curve is formed by Treasury yields of
different maturities normally the
two-year yield is quite a bit lower than
the 10-year yield over the last several
decades each time the yield curve
inverted when the two-year yield ended
up higher than the 10-year yield a
recession followed the last time we saw
this was the financial crisis so this
has become a popular recession indicator
and it keeps popping up and the Fed
governors are looking at this and they
don't like it they don't like anything
indicating that what they're doing is
bringing us into a recession so they
decided to do something very interesting
instead of backing off you know their
rate hikes and doing all this other
stuff they're gonna throw out the
flattening yield curve they're saying
that the yield curve
is an unreliable recession indicator in
other words the feds massive balance
sheet nine years of near zero interest
rate policy and other factors might be
distorting investors thinking and this
distorted thinking causes investors to
pile into long-term Treasuries at these
low yields and then push down the yields
further so the yield curve is distorted
we can't look at that it's not giving us
the real information know what they're
really saying is we need to cover up
everything that we've done we can't show
people this data and have it you know be
reported on so what are we're seeing
right now for the central bank to shape
the narrative of this next collapse well
we have the Wall Street Journal saying
that recession is coming in 2020 we had
the New York Post the economy is not
doing as great as Trump things we had
the Business Insider magazine saying
that the Fed says the tariffs might
wreck the economy the Fed discontinued
the Fred balance sheet data so you can't
see that and now they're throwing out
the inverted yield curve because it is
distorted so think about this for a
second what are they doing they are
shaping the narrative for the next
economic collapse and we're gonna see a
lot more of this and I didn't think it
was going to happen this quickly but it
looks like they are really covering
their tracks right now and you can see
that they're getting ready and prepared
to bring this system down and they don't
want to have any data or information to
show that they were the ones that did
this why because they're gonna point the
finger they're gonna point the finger
someplace else and in the New York Post
and in The Business Insider magazine and
we're gonna see a lot of these store
more story more of these stories come
out they're going to start naming that
Trump is the problem and you notice with
the Wall Street Journal they're planning
on doing this before the 2020 elections
it's already planned right now because
they are stuck they know the system
cannot continue on like this and they're
very nervous and afraid that Trump of
the Patriots are going to bring down the
system and control the narrative
so we're headed for this major
transition and they've already started
the process now we talked about how they
were raising the interest rates and we
talked about what happened last time
when we hit the Great Recession in 2008
they slowly raised the interest rates
looks like a little step going up and
when it hit a certain point everything
started to break apart those rates fell
like an elevator you know dropping from
the top of the building with no breaks I
went straight down and what we're going
to see once again once we hit a certain

that we're already starting to see signs

we see San Francisco we see Canada we

we're gonna see things really start to

much as they used to interest rates are

aren't earning interest on their savings
that in the savings accounts and we know

dropping the only thing that's going up
right now is the stock market because
they have control over this but we see

understand that they don't have that

it's leading us that's why they're doing

believe that Russia and China and the
u.s. they're working together
because the eventual goal here is to get

for listening be well be safe and
especially be prepared thanks a lot
